Geospatial Data Scientist/Intelligence Analyst Embedded Alliance is recruiting qualified  Geospatial Data Scientist/Intelligence Analst  candidates to fulfill the duties and responsibilities described in the Position Description below. NOTE : This position requires a TS/SCI security clearance. Please do not apply if you do not have a security clearance. Job Description:  The candidate should have a geospatial background and a strong ability to independently conduct research and initiate projects in support of customer objectives. Gather data and present it on reports or on maps. Use a combination of computer and mathematical skills to develop applications and programs that can gather geospatial data. Develop Geographic Information Systems (GIS) that can be used by the intelligence community and or the Military. Responsible for determining how to improve programs to provide users with more effective information. Required Qualifications : Active Top Secret/SCI security clearance required. Bachelor/Master degree with 4+ years in Quantitative discipline such as data science, mathematics, statistics, earth science, quantitative social sciences, geographic information science, computer science, physics, etc., or relevant discipline experience. Experience processing geospatial data including Georeferencing, orthorectifying and mosaicking imagery, re-projecting, routing. Familiarity with aeronautical and nautical charts as well as terrain data. Expertise skills in programming, analytical, mathematical, problem-solving. Strong analytical skills, teaching skills, teamwork skills, technical skills. Develop scripts and algorithms (e.g. Python), create explanatory and predictive models, and conduct comparative analyses to address complex GEOINT problems. Create, edit, research, evaluate, analyze, and fuse data from multiple sources and datasets to produce current and finished geospatial intelligence products. Develop and apply methods to identify, collect, process, and analyze large volumes of data to build and enhance products, processes, and systems. Solve and automate classification, regression, cluster analysis, anomaly detection, association discovery, and topic modeling tasks. Develop and utilize solutions with predictive patterns from data into practical, intelligent applications that anyone can use. Create and maintain geodatabases and integrate and manage foundation, intelligence, and multi-INT data into structured geodatabases. Create explanatory and predictive models and conduct comparative analyses to address complex military and intelligence problems. Desired Qualifications:  Experience with the following software packages and technologies: ArcGIS, Python, R, Tableau. Familiarity with geospatial charts as well as terrain data. Experience conducting training sessions. About Embedded Alliance:  Embedded Alliance is a certified veteran, minority, woman owned small business focused on merging database management and visualization techniques to drive GOEINT analysis; working with our partners and community to provide innovative geospatial solutions. If you have what it takes, join us. Embedded Alliance is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. U.S. Citizenship is required. Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Employee discount Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Professional development assistance Referral program Retirement plan Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: Mask is required for everyone, social distancing at desk, and sanitizer available. Application Question(s): Do you have an active security clearance? How many years of relevant experience do you have? Do you have the following license or certification: US Citizenship? Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: ArcGIS: 4 years (Preferred) Python: 5 years (Preferred) Tableau: 5 years (Preferred) Security clearance: Top Secret (Required) Work Location: One location

Do you enjoy meaningful work in an environment where you can make an impact, learn, and collaborate with others who are just as passionate about their work as you are? Are you a self-starter and consider your strengths to be solving complex problems, building client and stakeholder relationships, proactive teamwork, analytical thinking, and project management? If so, we are looking for you! Corner Alliance is a dynamic, growing consulting firm that devotes itself to providing an enriching employee experience while meeting project deliverables. We are looking to add an energetic,  Senior Data Analyst  with  6-8 years of experience  to our  Washington, DC/Remote team  that will add to our culture and fully embrace our commitments to deliver, grow and thrive. During your tenure with us, you will work on various projects across Federal agencies. Those who have fulfilling careers here get involved across the company, helping the organization grow and supporting a thriving work environment. Whether you’re a Consultant or in Operations, you will work in meaningful ways to  create results for the government . About the Role: This is a temporary, part-time role . You will design a data collection strategy and use the data collected to create a story of impact for a Federal government client with responsibilities spanning: stakeholder outreach, data strategy and analysis, meeting support, developing graphical depictions of data, guiding team members on strategy execution, and contributing to initial and final program recommendation reports. About the Responsibilities: (but not limited to): In this role you will be responsible for the following activities: Supporting internal and client strategy meetings Designing a data collection strategy Analyzing, modeling, and interpreting data Critical thinking to problem solve Identifying methodological approaches Planning and resourcing work to meet client deadlines You will have an opportunity to present data findings directly to the government client. Additionally, you will be required to guide junior analysts on data collection execution and best practices. You will contribute to an overall business process improvement report for a federal client based on the data collection findings and create interim findings reports. This project is a team effort and possessing emotional intelligence, communication skills, and ability to be a team player will be paramount. Lastly, you must be committed to carry out our Commitments to Deliver, Grow, and Thrive. Location: You will work as part of a dynamic remote team until it is safe to be at the client-site in Washington, DC. *You will interview, onboard, and work remotely due to COVID-19 until it is safe to return to the office* Required Experience/Skills: Bachelor’s degree and 6-8 years of professional experience 6+ years of experience in Data Analysis, Statistics, or a related field Qualitative and Quantitative Data Theming Statistical Knowledge Facilitated Session Methodology Knowledge of data analytic tools (such as tableau, logframe, and iGrafx) Data visualization; ability to translate data to describe, predict, and improve business performance Writing and communication skills Critical thinking Presentation skills Attention to detail US citizenship or permanent resident and the ability to pass public trust clearance or suitability Preferred Experience/Skills: Degree and/or certification in data science, statistics, accounting, or mathematics Grants Management Knowledge Don’t think you have everything for this role but are still very interested? Please don’t hold back from applying because you may not have it all. There's no such thing as a perfect candidate. You can learn and grow with us. So, please apply if you consider yourself to be detail-oriented, can re-prioritize in a fast-paced environment, have great client management and people management skills, can manage high quality deliverables on time and this is a role that would make you excited to come to work every day. And the part about consulting? You also don’t need to have a consulting background to apply - we have consultants here from many different backgrounds: non-profits, associations, government, private sector and anything in between. We offer a 2 day orientation where we teach you the Corner Alliance Way of Delivery (which is Consulting). What you need is to have transferable skills: an eagerness to improve things, being analytical, applying critical thinking, having good writing skills, being curious about how things fit into the bigger picture, being able to break a project up into tasks and implement them, being personable and having an ability to build trust with our clients and colleagues. About Us: We are a dynamic and growing management consulting firm headquartered in downtown DC focused on creating an experience that feels a bit different for our clients. We have their backs, push them with new ideas, and start every solution with their stakeholders to create high-performing, high-results Federal Government programs. Corner Alliance is serious about our Commitments: to Deliver excellence, Grow the business and Thrive in a vibrant environment. Our Core Purpose is simple and meaningful: We work with government to create results. Corner Alliance offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package for full time employees including 401k matching (4%), PTO (3 weeks to start, 4 weeks (2-5 years) and 5 weeks (5 years+)), health, dental, vision, short- and long-term disability, FSA accounts, 4 weeks of paid parental leave, 11 paid holidays (including your birthday off), fitness & cell phone reimbursements, monthly all hands update meetings, annual in-person all hands team building day and evening out, regular check-ins for professional growth goals, semi-monthly one on one performance manager meetings, a social team that coordinates monthly events, use of technology like Slack to keep us connected and collaborative, and overall, a company culture dedicated to a highly engaged team. Be a part of our award-winning firm and the great things we are doing - we are a recurrent Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Company honoree and a past Winner of the Society of Human Resource Management When Work Works award for our amazing workplace culture. Corner Alliance is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, or any other basis covered by applicable law. In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendments Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a position with Corner Alliance please call  (202) 754-8120  or email recruiting@corneralliance.com. Corner Alliance participates in the E-verify program and will provide the Federal Government with Form I-9 information to confirm work authorization in the U.S. Visit us at www.corneralliance.com to learn more. The mission of the Data Science team is to enhance Cvent’s products with AI and machine learning driven features, and to enable the company to make data-informed decisions at all levels. Cvent has a vast amount of data, and significant domain expertise, which we are using to design intelligent features that deliver value to our customers. We are on AWS, use Tableau as a reporting & dashboarding tool, and have recently started using Snowflake as an enterprise data warehouse.   We are hiring a Data Analyst II to work on statistical analysis of data, creating dashboards, and building and maintaining documentation on data. You must be highly collaborative and used to taking initiatives: you will work with data scientists, software developers and product managers on a daily basis. You will be an integral part of a fast-growing team, strongly committed to impacting the company via industry-leading machine learning, data products and data analytics.   What you will do:   Perform statistical analysis of data.  Design randomized controlled trials (A/B tests), and analyze results.  Build and maintain dashboards for the Data Science team, using Tableau, Amazon QuickSight, and possibly other tools.  Understand Cvent's data: for example, what data points are captured from a particular product line and how specific data tables were created.  Use this understanding of data to create and maintain data dictionaries relevant to the Data Science team.  Communicate relevant findings and results to the team.   Basic qualifications:   A Bachelor's degree in statistics or another quantitative field.  At least 2 years of experience working as a data analyst in industry.  Proficiency working with relational (SQL) databases.  Proven skills in data visualization and dashboard creation.  Deep experience with Tableau.  Experience designing and analyzing A/B tests.  Critical thinking and strong problem-solving ability.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.   Advanced qualifications:    Master's or higher degree in statistics or another quantitative field.  Proficiency in the Python language.  Experience with noSQL data stores.  Familiarity with AWS services, especially QuickSight as a dashboarding tool.  Familiarity with Snowflake.  Understanding of data modeling and data store management.  Conceptual understanding of machine learning.  Proven ability for proactive, independent work with minimal supervision.   If you are a good fit for the role, please apply! Your resume should be no more than two pages in length.

Applications for data analysis include tracking, acoustics, imagery, cyber security, and preventive maintenance.  The work will be performed in our Research and Development Lab in Columbia, MD. Duties: Define Data collection, ingestion and wrangling approaches Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms Combine models through ensemble modeling Present information using data visualization techniques Collaborate with Navy product users Qualifications: Must be a U.S Citizen BS in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field; graduate degree in Data Science or another quantitative field is preferred 4+ years of proven experience as a Data Scientist Experience in data mining, artificial intelligence and Machine Learning Knowledge of R, SQL, Python, Scala, Java or C++ is an asset Experience with neural networks Strong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra) Possess or have the ability to obtain DoD secret clearance  In-Depth Engineering remains committed to hiring during the period of uncertainty associated with COVID-19. Job Summary: As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be the key technical expert, accountable for exam performance and psychometrics, resolution of data issues, and research addressing the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) strategic goals. With an analytical mindset, you will lead efforts and provide consultation for the Measurement Services staff to resolve data problems and establish data quality standards, develop presentations and publications for departments, Board of Directors, Commission on Certification, and other stakeholders. In addition, you will propose resources to support Measurement Services research activity. You are an expert in test development, scoring, research, and quantitative analyses, and skilled in developing software applications, programming, and syntax for report generation, statistical analyses, and graphic representations.    WHAT YOU WILL DO Conduct ongoing analysis of data systems, review data management plans, revisions, and specifications and provide feedback Plan and lead timely research (e.g., job analysis, validation, survey sampling, and readability, test security, calibration, equating) to enhance exam performance, customer services, and product line as well as inform strategic planning Monitor and evaluate item performance, differential item functioning, item drift, and exam psychometrics Program for advanced statistical analyses using software programs (e.g., SAS, SPSS, Winsteps, R, SQL) Create and implement report generation, data collection, and sampling plans, develop conceptual frameworks for research and analyses, and recommend and adapt analytical and statistical methods Identify strategies to generate useful feedback for examinees, draw conclusions from research and make recommendations Provide results, conclusions, and visuals, and present to internal and external stakeholders (e.g., Executive Leadership, Boards of Directors, Commissions/Councils, program staff, governmental agencies, members of credentialed organizations). Travel as needed to deliver presentations at various venues or to meet with potential or current stakeholders Plan and lead test development activities (e.g., standard setting, item and exam performance, exam field testing, form building) Facilitate focus groups, prepare meeting materials, review materials created by colleagues, analyze data, and write technical research reports and summaries Ensure compliance with industry best practice and accreditation requirements of ANCC certification programs, and maintain all necessary documentation in support of accreditation requirements Perform other duties as assigned to support the department’s objectives and strategic goals WHAT YOU BRING TO THE ANA Master’s degree (Ph.D. preferred) in industrial-organizational (I/O) psychology, testing and measurement, psychometrics, mathematics, research and statistics, or related field, with emphasis on quantitative analyses 5 years of professional experience, and 2 years of assessment development, psychometrics, data management and analyses, and technical report writing Research design and completion Data collection, utilization, validation and security Data management and visualization Advanced data analysis (e.g., scaling and equating [CTT or IRT], simulation, sampling) Choosing and applying appropriate analysis techniques Test construction, development of alternative items, and test validation Meeting facilitation Excellent oral and written communication, technical documentation and report writing Advanced use of office computer software (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and database and statistical software (e.g., SAS, SPSS, R, SQL) Ability to teach and mentor others and give professional feedback, organize, manage, and complete multiple ongoing projects and tasks, accurately attend to details, and adapt to changing priorities and work demands WHAT THE ANA BRINGS TO YOU Join us and become a “Nurse Advocate” for the more than 4 million Registered Nurses in the United States Every role within the ANA contributes to a healthier world through the “Power of Nursing” An organization that acts with integrity, respect, transparency and humility We embrace and empower the uniqueness of every employee; Bring your whole-self to work Continuously innovating through creative and strategic initiatives Excellent Benefits with exceptional retirement contributions including 401K Matching, Paid Time Off between Dec 25th and Jan 1st in addition to regular PTO, and excellent health/medical benefits Commitment to your career development and advancement throughout the ANA Enterprise ABOUT THE AMERICAN NURSES ASSOCIATION Founded in 1896, The ANA Enterprise is the family of non-profit companies that comprise the American Nurses Association: the American Nurses Association (ANA), the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC), and the American Nurses Foundation. The ANA Enterprise leverages the combined strength of each to drive excellence in practice and ensure nurses’ voices and vision are recognized by policy leaders, industry influencers, and employers. The ANA is an equal opportunity employer. job_title: Associate Director Enterprise Data & Analytics Infrastructure
job_Description: Department:  DIGITAL Reports to:  Chief Information Officer About us The Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Institute (PCORI) is an independent nonprofit organization authorized by Congress in 2010. Its mission is to fund research that will provide patients, their caregivers and clinicians with the evidence-based information needed to make better-informed healthcare decisions. PCORI is committed to continually seeking input from a broad range of stakeholders to guide its work. Position Summary The Associate Director, Enterprise Data & Analytics Infrastructure, will be part of the DIGITAL leadership team reporting to CIO and will partner and collaborate with all teams at PCORI to strategize, define, and implement enterprise-wide data and analytics infrastructure capabilities to deliver on PCORI’s mission. This role is critical because of the following reasons – Support PCORI teams to be data driven in supporting our mission Build and establish data and analytics infrastructure for PCORI (Big Data Lake, Data Connection, Data Storage, Data Centralization, Data Transformation, Data Availability, Data Quality, and Analytics Infrastructure – PowerBI / Tablaeu) Centralize data and analytics infrastructure that will enable all teams at PCORI to have consistent and clean data available on automated dashboards to get insights and drive strategic actions Reduce manual processes for all teams at PCORI to collect data, transform data and create automated analytics dashboards Create Artificial Intelligence (e.g., Natural Language Processing), Machine Learning (predictive modeling) and advanced data science (e.g., Python, Jupiter Notebooks, Workbench) capabilities for PCORI The Associate Director, Enterprise Data & Analytics Infrastructure will lead a team of data managers, data architects, data engineers, data developers, analytics / visualization engineers, ETL experts. The Associate Director, Enterprise Data & Analytics Infrastructure will work with all team members in matrix structure to deliver on the requested capabilities. Duties & Responsibilities Strategic Direction and Leadership:  Lead and provide the vision for shaping the data and analytics infrastructure for PCORI. Provide strategic direction and operational leadership to a team of highly technical employees in the Enterprise Data and Analytics platform infrastructure and capabilities build area of DIGITAL team. Plan and implement a resource strategy (internal versus vendor) based on business need, scope of work, cost, and skill requirements. Foster a collaborative, success-oriented team environment where resources are empowered and accountable. Build and Operationalize Centralized Data & Analytics Infrastructure for PCORI:  Develop the architecture and framework for data and analytics infrastructure across the company - standardization of data collection, data automation, data centralization, data transformation (ETL), visualization connection and analytics infrastructure. Leverage Big Data cloud technologies (AWS, Azure) provide data, analytics, IT, technology and consulting for all PCORI teams to build and deploy the right solutions and capabilities that meet the mission needs Thought Leadership in Determining Business Needs:  Collaborative partner with stakeholders to define business requirements and build the right data and analytics infrastructure capabilities. Collaborate with all business teams to understand business strategy and mission Develop and drive a supporting data and analytics strategy, including a multi-year road map. Architect solutions to ensure strategy and projects align with architectural design, plan, and standards. Execution:  Create a data and analytics pipeline through APIsand FTP securely by leveraging modern coding solutions like Python. Leverage Microsoft (Azure), AWS data pipeline / cloud solutions, and PowerBI/Tablaeu to build the data and analytics infrastructure. Execute with program management rigor, matrix team structure, and software development best practices. Operationalize and enable data and analytics governance that will focus on ensuring adherence to an enterprise data governance framework for data policies, standards and practices to achieve the required level of consistency, quality and protection to meet overall business needs Automated Solutions & Innovation:  Create data and analytics infrastructure for PCORI teams that is automated and can provide self service Leverage AI, ML solutions to do predictive modeling and drive innovation (e.g., NLP) for the organization. Team Oversight:  Manage a team supporting multiple groups to deploy Big Data technologies, analytics platforms and applications capable of powering real time analytics Incumbent(s) in this position may be required to perform other duties and special assignments not specifically stated above. Statements outlined in this section are designated as essential job functions in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. Required Skills Will lead, build and establish highly technical and innovative big data and analytics infrastructure team for PCORI. This is the central team for PCORI that will build the data and analytics infrastructure for all teams at PCORI to be data driven (e.g., data availability, dashboards etc.) can leverage holistically The Associate Director, Enterprise Data & Analytics Infrastructure should posses both strategic leadership and hands-on competence to lead highly technical data architects, data managers, data science professionals and analytics experts who are skilled in programming languages (like python), big data (Azure, AWS, PowerBI) and data management technologies (e.g., ETL). S/He should be highly technical with hands on data and analytics coding, big data cloud technologies, and cloud based analytics development on platforms such as AWS/S3, Azure, Spark, Python, PowerBI, Tablaeu The Associate Director will have both strategic and execution tasks. Examples include – Provide strategic direction and operational leadership to a team of highly technical employees in the Enterprise Data and Analytics platform and capabilities Develop and maintain an organization of high performing people through effective hiring, coaching, and rigorous performance/talent management processes Plan and implement a resource strategy (internal versus vendor) based on business need, scope of work, cost, and skill requirements. Foster a collaborative, success-oriented team environment where resources are empowered and accountable. Envision scalable enterprise data and technology architecture in support of data lakes as well as descriptive & predictive analytics for all critical business data from across internal and external data sources and applications. Serve as a technology product owner of the Data Lake capabilities, ensuring that the capability is built and operated optimally with robust technology tools and processes, efficiently managing the total cost of ownership of the product. Manage a team supporting multiple groups to deploy Big Data technologies, analytics platforms and applications capable of powering real time analytics. The Associate Director will leverage industry best in class Big Data methodologies and PCORI Data Governance guidance in building and implementing data and analytics infrastructure capabilities Required Experience Bachelors degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, MIS, or related field; or equivalent work experience. 10+ years of Big Data and Analytics Infrastructure Strategy, Build and Execution relevant experience required. 10+ years of experience in technology and/or software development, progressing in complexity and responsibility. 7+ years of leadership experience that includes leadership of data and analytics infrastructure technical projects and teams. 7+years hands on experience in Cloud technologies and cloud based analytics development on platforms such as Azure, AWS, GCP, Snowflake, Python, Jupyter, PowerBI, Tablaeu etc. 7+ years hands on Data Modeling experience and, in general, be familiar with a variety of techniques to consume and process large data volumes/datasets. 7+years experience in administrating advanced analytic tools and providing analytics solution expertise to cross functional delivery teams and data domain owners 7+ years of proven experience and success in strategy planning and execution. 7+ years of experience in a data or business intelligence product role or equivalent 7+ years of experience and proven success in developing/supporting large volume transaction systems Experience working in an agile environment (eg. user stories, iterative development, etc.) Experience in working in health care industry Background in multiple programming languages and SQL Demonstrated maturity and effectiveness in leadership of technical projects and teams. Demonstrated superior ability to deliver technical solutions of increasing scope, complexity, visibility and criticality on time and within budget through both vendor and employee resources. Demonstrated thought leader and innovator in using technology to move the business forward. Highly effective communication skills that includes the ability to deliver technical information to non-technical audiences. The health and safety of our employees is a top priority. As part of that commitment, PCORI requires all employees, regardless of remote work status, to be vaccinated against COVID-19. As a prospective and/or new employee at PCORI, you will be required to comply with PCORI's vaccination policy, report your vaccination status, and provide proof of vaccination. Compliance with the policy does allow for exceptions, but those exceptions will only be granted in circumstances related to medical conditions, disabilities, and sincerely held religious beliefs. Continuing with this application indicates your intent to comply with PCORI's Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. PCORI conducts background checks on all applicants. PCORI’s Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:  PCORI is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity both internal and external to the workplace. You can learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion  here . All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. Job Type: Full-time

Kingstonville, LLC is a management consultancy, with core competencies in Program Management, Risk Management and Administrative Management in support of mission driven programs for our federal clients. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with a company match, commuter benefits, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, paid time off and more. Kingstonville is seeking a Data Scientist to join a team. This candidate will be a part of a team communicators supporting Heliospheric missions and science at our client's site in Washington DC. These missions include Solar Orbiter and Parker Solar Probe which provide discoveries of what is happening with our sun and the Heliospheric environment. The team communicates NASA science through web posts, social media, video production and podcasts. Team members have a goal of expanding the reach of science communication to broad audiences including secondary schools, Hispanic communities, the public as well as providing information to scientists and experts. The successful candidate will work remotely temporarily but will be required to work at the client site once it fully reopens. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Serve as a support scientist, for example, specify data product metadata. Compile, analyze and provide various metrics (ingest, archive, distribution and user) to ESDIS Project, NASA HQ, and instrument teams. Perform special and anomalous metrics analyses/studies Work as a substitute Interface Manager for EOS instrument science teams attend bi-weekly telecons as needed, prepare/distribute meeting minutes Develop interface requirements documents for processing of instrument data. Provide system engineering support for development of programs to support data analysis and reporting. Support development and host functions for conducting seminars using internet-based tools, such as webinars. Support organizing end user workshops and participation in the various conferences in the communication capacity as required. QUALIFICATIONS Proficiency in remotely sensed Earth Science products from the various instruments onboard the NASA/NOAA satellites, Including EOS Terra, Aqua, Aura, NPP. Experience conducting meetings, interfacing with technical groups, such as Science Team Members, and developing technical materials, such as Interface Control Documents. Familiarity with the airborne data, e.g. ICEBridge, EV-1 Experience in system software development, preferably EOSDIS components Experience in querying Oracle databases using SQL Experience in MS office S/W (Excel, Word, Power Point) Excellent communication (written & oral), and teamwork skills US Citizenship or Permanent Residency Required. At least Master’s degree in physical sciences At least 5 years of experience in earth sciences including remote sensing of geophysical parameters At least 3 years of experience in system software development Solid knowledge of remotely sensed Earth data products and data processing particularly those from NASA Earth Observing System (EOS) instruments Excellent communication (written & oral), and teamwork skills' 'Work Location:  One location Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Health insurance Paid time off Schedule: Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: Greenbelt, MD 20770: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred) Application Question(s): What are your salary requirement? Education: Master's (Preferred) Experience: earth science: 5 years (Preferred) system software development: 3 years (Preferred) remotely sensed Earth data products and data processing: 1 year (Preferred) querying Oracle database: 1 year (Preferred) MS office: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location

Description: The Senior Data Steward supports the Department of the Army Intelligence Information Services (DAIIS), operationally controlled by Headquarters, Department of the Army (HQDA) ACofS G-2 Intelligence Community Information Management Division (DAMI-IM) and administratively supported by the United States Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM). DAIIS delivers leading-edge information sharing and operational intelligence knowledge management solutions across the international intelligence enterprise for tactical, joint, DoD, Intelligence Community (IC), and coalition customers to enable broad information sharing and national to tactical integration across U.S. and multinational computer/security domains. DAIIS fulfills 24 X 7 requirements for intelligence dissemination as well as cross-domain file transfer service in support of defined Joint Task Force intelligence mission requirements. This position will:: Provide data management and data governance support using government-provided tools. Provide support to the customer to sustain operations and maintain technology platforms to ensure data access and control for government Data Stewards and Data Managers to deliver information to the Army Intelligence Enterprise (AIE), the Department of Defense (DoD), and the Intelligence Community (IC) Execute and record tasks utilizing an agile framework and agile tools Record and log all tasks within the Defense Intelligence Information Enterprise (DI2E) Agile environment (JIRA/Confluence) Support the government in the development of plans, policy, and operations to execute Army-wide strategic governance, direction, policy, plans, oversight, and guidance to address Army (as an IC element) data and architecture Propose new policies, frameworks, and plans to the government Provide customer engagement and government support for data platforms identified by the government Create and maintain code to implement data policy identified by data providers Create and maintain code to support object-based production, data transformation, artificial intelligence, and machine learning Issue Non-Person Entity (NPE) Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) certificates based on provided SOP, to create trusted and authorized data exchanges between systems Create data pipelines (such as a dataflow in Apache NiFi, a Kafka topic, or a combination of other solutions) in accordance with industry best practices Onboard data providers and establish formal documentation for each data source Establish, Build, Maintain, Digitize, and integrate Data Sharing Agreements (DSA). Integrate DSA into data platforms (such as Cloudera, Immuta, Donodo, etc)., leveraging an agile method/agile tools (i.e., DI2E) Coordinate Army level policy, agreements, and other formal documents to ensure the broad dissemination and access to data Create, maintain, document, and support the data governance process, within provided data platforms Supervise a team to provide 24x7 Helpdesk tier 1 & 2 support; Execute system monitoring, support system patching and updates, participate in failover activities and inform the government of any change to available critical services Build, Maintain, and Expose data catalog into government-directed DAIIS Automated Data Governance Solution (DADGS). Produce metrics, graphics, and briefings as required to support production management and mission management functions Draft and maintain documentation such as Standard Operating Procedures and produce reports incorporating text and graphics to convey complex concepts Circinus, LLC offers extremely competitive compensation and benefits including company subsidized medical, dental, and vision coverage and company-paid life insurance and short and long-term disability. We also offer a 401(k) plan with a company match as well as paid holidays and personal time off. . Requirements: Active Top Secret Level Clearance with SCI Eligibility REQUIRED with an ability to obtain a CI polygraph Master’s degree in related field Minimum 10 years of experience in an intelligence discipline working in the DoD or IC within the last 2 years. Minimum of 4 years of technical experience providing data integration support including data governance, data architecture, data warehousing, data quality management, metadata management, data operations management, and data discovery. Minimum 4 years experience leading a team and managing work tasks of subordinates conducting intelligence planning, collection, processing, analysis, or dissemination OR a Bachelor’s degree in a related field and 12 years experience OR an Associates degree and 17 years of experience Ability to obtain DoDD 8140.01 (formerly DoDD 8570.01-M) certification / IT Level II within 30 Calendar days Experience in foreign disclosure and intelligence dissemination Experience involving complex security classification decisions such as coalition/foreign partner support, foreign disclosure, intelligence dissemination, or cross-domain operations Experience working with bilateral or multilateral partners in the areas of intelligence information sharing or intelligence data/system interoperability  Ability to deliver professional briefings and presentations to diverse audiences including senior Government personnel Ability to instruct and interact with small groups on data and information requirements and coordination tasks Proficiency in Microsoft Office Products (e.g., Access, Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) Ability to multitask and adapt to evolving requirements Additional Desired Qualifications; Familiarity with the Army Intelligence Unified Data Environment (UDE) Knowledge of or direct work for INSCOM G2 or other INSCOM staff

Title: Senior Data Scientist Location: FDA Headquarters, Silver Spring, MD Reports to: Paul Mazariegos FLSA Status: Exempt Position Summary: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is responsible for protecting the public health by assuring the safety, efficacy, and security of human and veterinary drugs, biological products, medical devices, our nation's food supply, cosmetics, and products that emit radiation. The FDA is also responsible for advancing the public health by helping to speed innovations that make medicines and foods more effective, safer, and more affordable, and helping the public get the accurate, science-based information they need to use medicines and foods to improve their health. The mission of the Center for Devices and Radiological Health (CDRH) is to protect and promote the public health. CDRH assure that patients and providers have timely and continued access to safe, effective, and high-quality medical devices and safe radiation-emitting products. CDRH's Office of Product Evaluation and Quality (OPEQ) leads CDRH's total product lifecycle (TPLC) reviews of medical devices marketed in the U.S. OPEQ plans, conducts and coordinates Center actions regarding approval, denial, and withdrawal of approval of Premarket approval applications (PMAs), product development protocols (PDPs) and investigational device exemptions (IDEs); makes substantially equivalent determinations for premarket notification submissions 510(k)s; and monitors sponsors conformance with requirements of all programs. The Office of Regulatory Programs (ORP) in OPEQ is seeking the services of an experienced data scientist. This data scientist shall conduct analyses to support managerial decision making and enhance understanding of the medical device review programs of the OPEQ in the CDRH. Duties/Responsibilities: Responsible for ongoing, independent, and active analytical skills in the development of performance measures, quantitative methods, and models. Analyze data using statistical approaches such as linear progression, classification, sampling methods, and/or subset selection. Analyze interpret unique and highly specialized datasets, in data systems used OPEQ. Evaluate data warehousing strategies to meet the needs of ORP. Utilize a variety of data analytic tools to analyze and interpret unique and highly specialized datasets; Synthesizing data and performing all phases of a systems development required for the design, development, and implementation of features enabling data access to draw conclusions and/or make predictions based on data summaries or statistical analyses. Utilizing a variety of data analytic tools to analyze interpret unique and highly specialized datasets, in data systems used by OPEQ. Solve complex analytical problems using quantitative approaches; Communicate data findings to stakeholders using different visual formats to picture and provide reports; and Provide technical expertise to product teams in the development, implementation and oversight of new technologies related to data science. Apply quantitative methods to summarize data and identify trends, correlations, relationships, means, medians, percentiles, ranges, distributions, and outliers. Communicate issues, analyses, findings, conclusions, and recommendations both orally and in writing. Minimum Requirements: Preferred of an MS and 10+ years of experience or PhD and 5+ years of experience with a particular job, task or skill. Advance understanding about scientific research business processes and all matters related to this area. Must demonstrate expertise in SAP BusinessObjects for data reporting and sharing and is proficient in writing code utilizing VBA, SQL database code, MATLAB and/or Python and utilizing visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI to convey statistical or technical information. Shall collaborate with other scientists and professionals, such as business analysts, to recommend solutions to meet business requirements. Must exhibit mastery of the English language, both orally and in writing. Requires expert knowledge and skill with PC-based Microsoft software, specifically Outlook, Word, Visio, Excel, and PowerPoint. Apply online at our website: https://kikiktagruk.applicantpool.com/ Disclaimer:  This is not to be an exclusive list of all responsibilities', duties, and skills required of the person in this job. KIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. KIC considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, physical or mental disability, family responsibility, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, veteran's status or any other legal protected status. Pursuant to The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act 43 U.S.C. Sec. 1601 et seq., and federal contractual requirements, Kikiktagruk Inupiat Corporation, may legally grant certain preference in employment opportunities to KIC Shareholders and their Descendants. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V. Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here. Successful candidate must pass, comply and adhere to KIC's Drug and Alcohol policy/testing requirements and pass a thorough background check including fingerprinting.

About the Team STR’s Analytics division researches and develops advanced analytics and machine learning-based solutions to solve challenging problems related to national security. Our team consists of passionate and motivated engineers with advanced degrees in engineering, computer science, mathematics, and data sciences, who are seeking opportunities to use their deep technical knowledge and creativity to tackle some of the hardest problems that our customers face. Our team members produce everything from novel, peer-reviewed research results to robust, deployed capabilities. Our projects span multiple different data modalities and incorporate advanced algorithms, deep learning, and statistical techniques to uncover patterns in social media, structured and unstructured text, time series, geospatial, and imagery data, and must operate under challenging constraints not typically found in the commercial world. The tools and technologies we develop have real world impact and are used by analysts to extract and enrich intelligence information around the globe.  The Role In the  Machine Learning Engineer – Data Science role , you will develop, implement, and evaluate statistical machine learning algorithms to uncover hidden information and patterns from a diverse collection of massive datasets. You will apply state of the art and novel techniques such as supervised and unsupervised learning, machine learning, and deep learning to problems such as classification, anomaly detection, and forecasting to problems of national security and safety interest. You will develop cutting edge systems and work collaboratively with our software engineers to design and deploy models into production. You will interact with customers to understand requirements and apply iterative feedback to development to respond to their most critical problems. This position is based in-office and applicants should expect to primarily work onsite. Who You Are  Experienced team member who is excited to work with mission partners to leverage cutting-edge research for immediate impact  Motivated collaborator who is looking for the opportunity to work with a team of high-end researchers and engineers to develop and deploy cutting edge machine learning solutions  Excellent communicator and briefer, who is comfortable communicating with both technical and non-technical audiences  Have a deep understanding in range of machine learning methods e.g.: multiple regression, clustering, and classification techniques such as Support Vector Machines, Random Forests, Naïve Bayes Classifiers, and Deep Neural Networks  Proficient in one or more high level programming language such as Python, MATLAB, Java, or C++  Have a track record of developing, implementing, and evaluating statistical algorithms against real datasets  Possess a MS or PhD in a scientific field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or Physics  Have ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance  Even Better  Specialized expertise in a data-rich field such as time-series analysis, graph analytics, geospatial analysis, image processing, or Bayesian programming  Experience with one or more deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or Tensorflow  Experience working with large datasets and familiarity with big data infrastructure, such as AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Dask, or MapReduce  Experience in leading and directing research initiatives from inception to functional prototypes  Experience working large cross-functional team in disparate locations  Strong written communication skills  Active security clearance  All STR employees may be subject to COVID-19 vaccination requirement in response to Executive Order 14042 and accompanying Task Force Guidance, unless a medical or religious accommodation is formally approved by STR. STR is a rapidly growing technology company with locations north of Boston, MA, Arlington, VA and near Dayton, OH. We specialize in advanced research and development for defense, intelligence, and national security, trying to understand how to protect our society: from stopping malicious botnet attacks, to understanding cyber vulnerabilities, providing next generation sensors, radar, sonar, communications, and electronic warfare to developing artificial intelligence algorithms and analytics to make sense of the complexity that is exploding around us. STR is committed to creating a collaborative learning environment that supports deep technical understanding and recognizes the contributions and achievements of all team members. Our work is challenging, but you go home at night knowing that you pushed the forefront of technology and made the world a little safer. We recognize that the world is changing, that it is becoming more connected than ever before, making things change faster than before, and reshaping society in the process. We all want to understand this changing world and leave it better for our work. STR is not just any company. Our people, culture, and attitude along with their unique set of skills, experiences, and perspectives put us on a trajectory to change the world. We can't do it alone, though - we need fellow trailblazers. If you are one, join our team and help to keep our society safe! Visit us at www.str.us for more info. STR is an equal opportunity employer. We are fully dedicated to hiring the most qualified candidate regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. POSITION PROFILE  The Data Scientist will lead and expand the implementation of data science and machine learning models inside Ricoh's Marketing department. The Data Scientist's primary responsibility will be to leverage existing internal and external data to identify trends and relationships that result in actionable recommendations to improve Marketing performance and drive revenue. The Data Scientist is able to communicate findings to business partners and has strong consulting, communication, visualization, and storytelling skills. The Data Scientist will work with the Customer Reporting and Digital Analytics teams to develop and pilot predictive models for Sales.  JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Understand key business needs and questions from Marketing stakeholders Gather data from internal and external data sources, working with Customer Reporting and Digital Analytics team; automate, cleanse and validate data Lead analysis of internal and external data to identify trends, relationships and to answer key business questions From analysis, identify key insights and generate actionable recommendations to improve Marketing performance and drive revenue Design, build, test, validate, iterate and maintain predictive and statistical models; deploy and run machine learning algorithms Incorporate a variety of statistical and machine learning techniques such as logistic regression, experimental design, generalized linear models, mixed modeling, CHAID/decision trees, neural networks, ARIMA, and ensemble models Create data visualizations to distill complex datasets and modeling into easy to understand visuals Work with Manager to present and gain alignment from Marketing leadership on recommended actions; influence decision-makers of business benefits of models and recommendations Work with stakeholders to operationalize and implement predictive models and algorithms across various Marketing tools and platforms Partner with and in some cases lead third party partners / agency as needed to support analytics and modeling projects Work with team leaders to build short and long term vision for data science practice inside Marketing Share data science best practices within Marketing and across the organization to build data science community and knowledge Provide inputs and perspective to Customer Reporting and Digital Analytics team on data infrastructure, tools, software (AI and machine learning) and processes to improve modeling, efficiencies and automation; support business case for investment in tools and technology QUALIFICATIONS (Education, Experience, and Certifications)   Work experience: 3-5 years work experience in data science, statistics, analytics, business intelligence Education: degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, statistics, computer science; graduate degree preferred  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES   Understanding of statistical programming and scripting in a language (R or Python preferred) Experience with machine learning, data cleansing and data visualization Experience with SQL Experience with Google Marketing Platform, Google Analytics and Google Big Query strongly preferred Knowledge of statistical concepts such as regression, time series, mixed model, Bayesian, clustering In addition to strong technical skills, has business acumen and can apply business logic to data and validate that the data makes sense Ideally, has experience with Oracle tools and systems (Sales Cloud, Eloqua, Hyperion, OBIEE) but not required Self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset Proactive in building workplans, building models and developing recommendations Uses sound judgment to identify issues and escalates when appropriate Resolve disagreements and conflicts constructively, knows when to involve others Ability to identify key needs or gaps and provide leadership recommendations to close those gaps Communication skills: can take complex processes and explain to business stakeholders Analytical skills: can look at complex data and distill into key actionable insights Self-aware: reflects and is honest about strengths and development opportunities; seeks and accepts feedback, and asks for help when needed Strong collaborator and team player  WORKING CONDITIONS, MENTAL AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS   Typically works in an office environment with adequate lighting and ventilation, and a normal range of temperature and noise level. Work assignments are diversified. Interpret, comprehend and apply complex material, data and instruction – prepare, provide and convey diversified information. Minimal physical effort required. Work is mostly sedentary but does require walking, standing, bending, reaching, lifting or carrying objects that typically with less than 10 lbs. (e.g., papers, books, files and small parts, etc.). Moderate dexterity – regular application of basic skills (calculator, keyboard, hand tools, eye/hand coordination. Visa Sponsorship is not offered for this position.  Ricoh is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer - Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled. Additional Pay Details:   Compensation Range is: $100,000-$130,000   Position is eligible up to 16% STI Click Here to view RicohUSA Benefits

job_title: FELLOWSHIPS IN DATA FUSION IN MEDICAL ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE / ML
location: 10903 New Hampshire Ave, Silver Spring, MD 20903
job_Description: FELLOWSHIPS IN DATA FUSION IN MEDICAL ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE / MACHINE LEARNING HELP ADVANCE PUBLIC HEALTH BY ACCELERATING ACCESS TO INNOVATIVE IMAGING  The FDA, an agency within the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, promotes public health by assuring the safety and effectiveness of drugs, vaccines and medical devices. The Office of Science and Engineering Laboratories (CDRH/OSEL) accelerates patient access to innovative, safe and effective devices through best-in-the-world regulatory science. There is a unique opportunity to conduct high performance computing (HPC) administration and user coding support JOIN A TEAM LEADING INNOVATION IN IMAGE SCIENCE FOR REGULATORY EVALUATION  The Division of Imaging, Diagnostics, and Software Reliability (DIDSR) develops methods for evaluating emerging medical imaging systems. Our research programs directly impact FDA’s regulatory assessments in areas including * AI/ML * WSI and digital pathology * Extended-reality (AR/VR) devices * Clinical trial design * In silico trials * Imaging physics. More information: https://www.fda.gov/about-fda/cdrh-offices/office-science-and-engineering-laboratories. ASSIGNMENT  The selected candidate will join a multi-disciplinary multi-center team of AI experts, engineers, physicists, geneticists, oncologists and other clinicians and train in a highly collaborative environment by conducting cutting edge research on AI/ML algorithms. Under the guidance of a mentor, training activities could include: Joint analysis of datasets that include serial radiological images and genomics information for the prediction of response to therapy for personalized medicine approaches. Development AI/ML pipelines to enable timely decisions about whether to continue a current treatment or seek an alternative, including Data harmonization Feature extraction from imaging, genomics and clinical data Feature selection and feature space reduction Modality fusion Performance evaluation Design of clean reproducible code that runs on our multi-GPU clusters Contribution to submissions to major conferences / journals and progress reports CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS  The qualified candidate should have received a doctoral degree in a relevant field such as engineering, physics, mathematics, computer science, statistics or a similar quantitative field, or be currently pursuing the degree with completion by December 31, 2021. Degree must have been received within the past five years. Preferred skills include: Previous experience, coursework, and solid foundation in one or more areas of machine learning, deep learning including CNNs, RNNs, LSTMs, and GANs, or computer vision. Excellent coding skills in Python and prior experience with machine learning code libraries Good oral and writing communication skills Previous experience with applying AI/ML, image and/or genomics analysis methods to medical data. Proven track record of research and peer-reviewed publications in engineering, computer science, or another relevant field of study Eligibility Requirements  Doctoral Degree received within the last 60 months or anticipated to be received by 12/31/2021 in the following discipline(s): Computer, Information, and Data Sciences, Engineering, Life Health and Medical Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics, or Physics. PERKS  Multiple opportunities to form collaborative efforts to tackle big questions in regulatory science of medical AI within FDA and with industry. Fantastic opportunities for training across the DC region. Competitive salary and telework flexibility. HOW TO APPLY Positions are available immediately and located in the White Oak Federal Research campus in Silver Spring (part of the metro DC region). US citizenship/permanent residency  not  required. Must meet security requirements including a minimum of 3 out of the past 5 years with residency status in the US. Submit your CV, cover letter and 3 references. Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary Pay: $82,000.00 - $88,057.00 per year Benefits: Health insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Education: Doctorate (Preferred) Experience: Machine Learning: 3 years (Required) Python coding: 3 years (Required) Work Location: One location

job_title: Data Scientist Engineer - Remote - DC area
job_Description: Fulltime W2 Only + Benefits ***US Citizen only please*** Hello, we are looking to bring on a Principal Data Engineer to add to the continued growth we are seeing with our Data Science division. This position will lead teams (or a team) in the design and execution of high-impact data architecture and engineering solutions to customers across a breadth of domains and use cases. Minimum Requirements : 8+ years (5+ for Senior) of experience bringing databases, data integration, and data analytics/ML technologies to production with a PhD/MS in Computer Science/Data Science/Computer Engineering or relevant field, or 10+ years (7+ for Senior) of experience with a Bachelor’s degree Developing software code in one or more programming languages (Python, JavaScript, Java, Matlab, etc.) Expert knowledge in databases (SQL, NoSQL, Graph, etc.) and data architecture (Data Lake, Delta Lake) Knowledgeable in machine learning/AI methodologies Experience with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto, etc.) ETL Experience: Extract, Transform and Load. Experience in short release cycles and the full software lifecycle Experience with Agile development methodology (e.g., Scrum) Strong writing and oral communication skills to deliver design documents, technical reports, and presentations to a variety of audiences Ability to attract and develop high-performing data engineering/science teams with an inspiring leadership style Responsibilities:  Leading end-to-end architectural design and development lifecycle for new data services/products, and making them operate at scale Leading others and directly working on the development, testing, and documentation of software code and data pipelines for data extraction, ingestion, transformation, cleaning, correlation, and analytics Partnering with Program Managers, Subject Matter Experts, Architects, Engineers, and Data Scientists across the organization where appropriate to understand customer requirements, design prototypes, and optimize existing data services/products Leading/participating in technical development of white papers and proposals to win new business opportunities Setting the standard for Data Science excellence in the teams you work with across the organization, and mentoring junior members in the Data Science division Analyzing and providing feedback on product strategy Leading/participating in research, case studies, and prototypes on cutting-edge technologies and how they can be leveraged Working in a consultative fashion to improve communication, collaboration and alignment amongst teams inside the Data Science division and across the organization Helping recruit, nurture, and retain top data engineering talent Job Type: Full-time Pay: $100,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year Benefits: Health insurance Paid time off Schedule: 8 hour shift Education: Bachelor's (Required) Experience: Data Engineer: 3 years (Required) Databases (SQL, NoSQL, Graph, etc.): 3 years (Required) Data architecture (Data Lake, Delta Lake): 1 year (Required) ETL - Extract, Transform and Load: 2 years (Required) machine learning/AI methodologies: 1 year (Preferred) SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL): 1 year (Required) Python, JavaScript, Java, Matlab, etc.: 1 year (Required) Work Location: Multiple Locations

Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE:  GCI) is a subscription-led and digitally focused media and marketing solutions company committed to empowering communities to thrive. With an unmatched reach at the national and local level, Gannett touches the lives of millions with our Pulitzer-Prize winning content, consumer experiences and benefits, and advertiser products and services. Our current portfolio of media assets includes USA TODAY, local media organizations in 46 states in the U.S., and Newsquest, a wholly owned subsidiary operating in the United Kingdom with more than 120 local news media brands. Gannett also owns the digital marketing services companies ReachLocal, Inc., UpCurve, Inc., and WordStream, Inc., which are marketed under the LOCALiQ brand, and runs the largest media-owned events business in the U.S., USA TODAY NETWORK Ventures. To connect with us, visit www.gannett.com. Sr. Data Scientist, Audience Science The Data Science group which is a part of Gannett’s Enterprise Data Organization, designs and develops machine learning models and decision science solutions that enable our cross-functional partners across Product, Content and Marketing teams to predict performance, better understand audiences and then engage them with meaningful and delightful content experiences.  What you’ll do: In this exciting leadership opportunity, you will have the unique opportunity to roll up your sleeves and lead our core data science hub for the most central part of our business – Audience! Your role will directly impact how millions of our users across the communities we serve in connect and engage with our content and our products. Our ideal candidate is a collaborative and innovative problem solver, who is profoundly hands-on and is passionate about applying state-of-the-art solution frameworks and machine learning techniques to develop behavioral segments, audience propensities and other data products that embed strategic audience insights into Gannett’s daily decisions and value chains.  How you’ll make an impact:   Develop and/or improve predictive models to identify lookalike and high-propensity audiences to be targeted for acquisition, retention, and engagement.  Build behavior segments and personas by analyzing user preferences and affinities across the customer journey.  Analyze behavioral trends to uncover opportunities to improve overall personalization, as well as content, and product performance.  Understand the data deeply and effectively translate model outcomes and insights into actions and recommendations that lead to decisions and measurable ROI.   What you'll bring:   MS or PhD in a quantitative field, with 8+ years of hands-on experience in building, evaluating, deploying, and monitoring machine learning solutions in production to solve business problems.  Advanced knowledge of models for classification, regression, and time-series modeling. Deep learning expertise is preferred.  Experience working in cloud data platforms like GCP, Big Query, Qubole etc.  Experience working with Google web analytics data is a plus.  Excellent communication and storytelling ability with track record of translating model results into business insights, and then into actionable recommendations.  Gannett Co., Inc. is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. As such, we will consider all qualified applicants for employment and do not discriminate in connection with employment decisions on the basis of an applicant or employee’s race, color, national origin, ethnicity, ancestry, citizenship status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, marital status, personal appearance (including height and weight), sexual orientation, family responsibilities, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy status (including childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), education, genetic characteristics or information, political affiliation, military or veteran status or other classifications protected by applicable federal, state and local laws in the jurisdictions where Gannett employs employees. In addition, Gannett Co., Inc. will provide applicants who require a reasonable accommodation, as a result of an applicant’s disability or religion, to complete this employment application and/or any other process in connection with an individuals’ application for employment with Gannett Co., Inc. Applicants who require such accommodation should contact Gannett Co., Inc.’s Recruitment Department at Recruit@gannett.com.

WHAT WE DO MATTERS:  Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, Hitched, The Bash, The Bump, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life's milestones. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.  ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:  The Knot Worldwide is in search of a full-time Data Scientist. Our Data Scientists work with stakeholders across all departments within the company. They answer strategic questions and provide insight to internal decision makers ranging from executives and senior management to product managers and team leads. They also work with our product team to develop data driven algorithms that improve features on the website.  This opening is for our Marketplace zone which connects over 2 million engaged couples with +50,000 local wedding vendors (e.g. Venue, DJ, Florist, etc.) across the US each year. This position plays an essential role in solving complex problems across our two-sided marketplace in areas such as pricing, product strategy, and go-to-market optimization.  We are open to this role being based out of our New York City, NY or Washington, DC office locations.  RESPONSIBILITIES:   Create smarter product solutions for our couples and vendors  Answer strategic questions by analyzing behavioral data  Communicate, collaborate and present results to clients within The Knot Worldwide  Explore novel ways to look at our data   SUCCESSFUL DATA SCIENTIST CANDIDATES HAVE:   Master's Degree or Ph.D. preferred  Experience implementing auction based business models  Strong product experience  Proficiency in key statistical and machine learning techniques (predictive modeling, classification, clustering, text analytics, recommender systems , data mining methods, forecasting, and other advanced techniques)  Proficiency with R or Python  Familiarity with common Linux command line tasks and version control software like git or svn preferable  Ability to communicate effectively and influence others  Ability to work in a fast paced environment and shift gears quickly   At The Knot Worldwide, we believe you are more than a resume and invite you to go for it, take the leap of faith, and apply for this job if it sparks your passion to join TKWW and make a difference!  WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:   You Dream Big. You iterate and experiment to drive innovation.  You Love Our Users. You keep our global community at the center of everything you do.  You Do the Right Thing. You strengthen your team through respect, fairness, and inclusion.  You Hustle Every Day. You favor urgency and own your outcomes.  You Win Together. People are at the heart of our success and you play as a team.   WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:  The Knot Worldwide offers a unique employee experience and we are deeply proud of our award-winning culture. We offer a full benefits package including options for medical, dental and vision insurance and a 401k with company match. From flexible vacation and generous parental leave benefits to promoting wellness and giving back to our community, we believe in happiness above all else—in and out of the office.  -  The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. In addition to federal law requirements, The Knot Worldwide complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. The Knot Worldwide expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.  -  This position is not eligible for sponsorship.  -  If you are a resident of California, by submitting your application, you acknowledge that you've read the California Privacy Notice.
